intro: Spyridium ulicinum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spyridium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as heathlands and sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Spyridium ulicinum is adapted to thrive in dry conditions and is often found in coastal regions.
